revised_title: Investigation of Physical and Physiological Properties of Stovaine and its Homologues
tldr: The authors investigate the physical and physiological properties of stovaine and its homologues, comparing their effects on contractility of isolated muscle, blood pressure, and respiration. They find that the substitution of different groupings in stovaine results in a decrease of rate of action, with the ethyl derivative, stovaine, showing the most potent effect.
